summary: The Veterans Opportunity Act of 2025 aims to establish the Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration within the Department of Veterans Affairs. This new administration will oversee programs related to economic opportunity for veterans, dependents, and survivors. The bill outlines the Administration's organization, functions, and reporting requirements, including an annual report to Congress. It also creates an Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition, appointed by the President. The bill includes provisions for labor rights regarding employee transfers and a sense of Congress regarding budgetary impact. Additionally, it mandates reports and certifications to Congress related to transitioning services to the new administration.
